name: Bangor (Gwynedd)
adventure_notes: Main mainline hub for Northern Snowdonia. Direct bus links to Llanberis (Snowdon) and Ogwen Valley.

name: Llandudno Junction
adventure_notes: Key interchange for the Conwy Valley line into the heart of the national park.

name: Betws-y-Coed
adventure_notes: Located directly in the national park. Gateway to Gwydir Forest mountain bike trails.

name: Blaenau Ffestiniog
adventure_notes: Terminus of the Conwy Valley line. Direct access to Antur Stiniog downhill MTB centre.

name: Pont-y-Pant
adventure_notes: Request stop in the scenic Lledr Valley. Great for riverside walks.

name: Dolwyddelan
adventure_notes: Quiet base for hiking Moel Siabod away from the crowds.

name: Conwy
adventure_notes: Historic walled town station. Access to Conwy Mountain and the northern Carneddau.

name: Penmaenmawr
adventure_notes: Start point for the Druid's Circle walk and North Wales Path sections.

name: Llanfairfechan
adventure_notes: Direct access to the Carneddau range and Aber Falls via a longer walk.

name: Prestatyn
adventure_notes: Northern start/end point of the famous Offa's Dyke National Trail.

name: Holyhead
adventure_notes: Terminus for ferries to Dublin. Access to Holyhead Mountain and South Stack cliffs.

name: Bodorgan
adventure_notes: Closest station to Newborough Forest and Llanddwyn Island (requires walk/cycle).

name: Rhosneigr
adventure_notes: Walking distance to one of the UK's best windsurfing and kitesurfing beaches.

name: Ty Croes
adventure_notes: Access to the Anglesey Coastal Path on the western side.

name: Machynlleth
adventure_notes: Adventure capital of Mid Wales. Hub for Dyfi Bike Park and Cadair Idris access.

name: Dovey Junction
adventure_notes: Remote interchange accessible only by path. Birdwatching and wilderness walking.

name: Borth
adventure_notes: Station right by the beach. Access to Ynyslas sand dunes and submerged forest.

name: Aberystwyth
adventure_notes: Major hub for Ceredigion. Start of the Ceredigion Coast Path and Vale of Rheidol Railway.

name: Tywyn
adventure_notes: Connection to Talyllyn steam railway for hiking in the Dysynni Valley.

name: Llwyngwril
adventure_notes: Quiet coastal village with steep access to the coast path and prehistoric sites.

name: Fairbourne
adventure_notes: Access to the Blue Lake quarry and the start of the Mawddach Trail.

name: Morfa Mawddach
adventure_notes: Request stop at the end of Barmouth Bridge. Iconic estuary walking and cycling.

name: Barmouth
adventure_notes: Seaside resort with direct access to the Panorama Walk and ferry to Penmaenpool.

name: Dyffryn Ardudwy
adventure_notes: Access to vast sand dunes and Neolithic burial chambers.

name: Harlech
adventure_notes: Steep walk up to the castle. Good base for exploring the rugged Rhinog mountains.

name: Minffordd
adventure_notes: Interchange for Portmeirion village and the Ffestiniog Railway.

name: Porthmadog
adventure_notes: Hub for the Welsh Highland Railway to Beddgelert and Snowdon.

name: Criccieth
adventure_notes: Victorian seaside town with a castle. Access to the eastern Llyn Peninsula.

name: Pwllheli
adventure_notes: Terminus for the Cambrian Coast line. Bus hub for the entire Llyn Peninsula.

name: Fishguard & Goodwick
adventure_notes: Access to the rugged North Pembrokeshire coast and ferry to Ireland.

name: Haverfordwest
adventure_notes: County town hub. Buses to St Davids, Broad Haven, and Newgale surf beach.

name: Milford Haven
adventure_notes: Access to the Cleddau waterway and buses to the Dale peninsula.

name: Tenby
adventure_notes: Popular resort with direct access to beaches and boat trips to Caldey Island.

name: Saundersfoot
adventure_notes: Walkable to the village and beach. Great section of the coast path with tunnels.

name: Pembroke
adventure_notes: Historic castle town. Bus link to Freshwater West surfing beach.

name: Carmarthen
adventure_notes: Major transport hub. Gateway to West Wales and Brechfa Forest trails.

name: Llanelli
adventure_notes: Direct access to the flat, traffic-free Millennium Coastal Path.

name: Gowerton
adventure_notes: Northern gateway to the Gower Peninsula Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.

name: Swansea
adventure_notes: City hub. Direct buses to all Gower beaches including Rhossili and Llangennith.

name: Neath
adventure_notes: Bus links to Waterfall Country (Pontneddfechan) and Afan Forest.

name: Port Talbot Parkway
adventure_notes: Nearest mainline station to Afan Forest Park mountain biking centre.

name: Merthyr Tydfil
adventure_notes: Closest station to BikePark Wales and bus links to Pen y Fan.

name: Abergavenny
adventure_notes: Perfect base for walking the Sugar Loaf, Skirrid, and Blorenge mountains.

name: Chepstow
adventure_notes: Southern terminus of Offa's Dyke Path and gateway to the Wye Valley.

name: Llandovery
adventure_notes: Access to the remote western Brecon Beacons and Carmarthen Fans.

name: Knighton
adventure_notes: Station located right on the Offa's Dyke Path. Home of the trail centre.

name: Llandrindod
adventure_notes: Victorian spa town with local walking trails and bus links to Elan Valley.

name: Llanwrtyd
adventure_notes: Home of bog snorkelling. Mountain biking and walking in the Cambrian Mountains.

name: Sugar Loaf
adventure_notes: Remote request stop for hikers. Access to the Sugar Loaf viewpoint (not the mountain).

name: Pontypool & New Inn
adventure_notes: Access to Llandegfedd Reservoir for watersports and fishing.

name: Rhymney
adventure_notes: Valley line terminus with access to the southern edge of the Brecon Beacons.

name: Treherbert
adventure_notes: Valley terminus below the Rhigos mountain. Waterfalls access nearby.

name: Barry Island
adventure_notes: Classic seaside destination with beach and coast path access.

name: Aberdare
adventure_notes: Direct access to Dare Valley Country Park and trails.

name: Bridgend
adventure_notes: Hub for buses to the Glamorgan Heritage Coast and Merthyr Mawr dunes.

name: Pembrey & Burry Port
adventure_notes: Walking distance to Pembrey Country Park and its 8-mile beach.

name: Ferryside
adventure_notes: Scenic estuary station. Ferry crossing (seasonal) to Llansteffan Castle.

name: Kidwelly
adventure_notes: Famous medieval castle and canal walks nearby.

name: Chirk
adventure_notes: Access to Chirk Castle and the Llangollen Canal aqueduct.

name: Ruabon
adventure_notes: Bus link to Llangollen and the World Heritage Pontcysyllte Aqueduct.

name: Flint
adventure_notes: Coastal path access along the Dee Estuary and historic castle.
